body.p:
Internal Revenue,
Assessor's Office, Third Collection District,
Louisville Ky., Nov 11th 1862
James W. Tate Esq
Assistant Secretary State
Frankfort Ky

Dear Sir/owing to an omission in the U. S. Excise law I find that neither myself nor my assistants are qualified to administer an oath and as all returns made by Manufacturers ^and many others^ are required to be made under oath administered either by a Magistrate or Notary. it will be a great public convenience both for us to be properly qualified to administer the required oath. The defect in The National Law will doubtless be amended in this particular upon the meeting of Congress.
I enclose herewith five dollars with which to pay the necessary fees for the qualification as Notary Public of the following five gentlemen

Edgar Needham, Columbus Chamberlin
George C. Slaughter, William S. Davis Joseph C. Butler
Your immediate attention is respectfully requested

Edgar Needham
Assessor 3rd Collec Dist Ky.

Jefferson Co
Notaries Public
Ed. Needham
Co. Chamberlin
Geo. C. Slaughter
Wm S. Davis
Jos C. Butler
Comm Issd Nov 13 1862
